segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes, completely oblivious to the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is spreading right under her feet, but she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the children behind her, sneaking cookies like little thieves.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on a wobbly stool, reaching for the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think he’s going to fall any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is waiting with her hand out, as if this is perfectly normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe the woman hasn’t noticed any of this chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the water will ever stop running.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should warn them, but I’m just an observer.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is both funny and terrifying at the same time.
segments.speaker: PAR
